sentences.en: Broadway was thinly peopled with pedestrians.
sentences.cn: 百老汇大街上稀稀落落地还有些行人.

sentences.en: In her speech she made several thinly disguised attacks on the president.
sentences.cn: 她在演说中对总统作了几次稍加掩饰的抨击.

sentences.en: Much of the speech was a thinly disguised attack on the management of the company.
sentences.cn: 讲话内容大多是对公司管理层几乎不加掩饰的抨击。

sentences.en: Peel and thinly slice the onion.
sentences.cn: 剥掉洋葱皮，然后切成薄片。

sentences.en: Roll the pasta out as thinly as possible.
sentences.cn: 把面团擀开，擀得越薄越好。

sentences.en: She made a lot of thinly veiled accusations.
sentences.cn: 她多番指责,几乎毫不掩饰.

sentences.en: She spread the toast thinly with raspberry jam.
sentences.cn: 她在烤面包片上塗了薄薄的一层山莓酱.
把萝卜籽撒播得稀一些。

sentences.en: The mountain regions are more thinly populated than the lowlands.
Thinly paint the lamb with Dijon mustard.
sentences.cn: 在羊肉上刷上薄薄一层第戎产的芥子酱。

sentences.en: This is lust thinly disguised as love.
sentences.cn: 这表面是爱，其实是赤裸的欲望。

sentences.en: This last clause is a thinly-veiled threat to those who might choose to ignore the decree.
sentences.cn: 这最后一项条款明显是对那些可能会无视法令之人的威慑。

sentences.en: This satirical address was a thinly disguised stricture against the doctrine of the rights of man.
sentences.cn: 这一充满讽刺意味的演说几乎是对人权主义不加掩饰的指责.

sentences.en: Wilson smiled thinly. "We have decided to name the new Home after Councillor Minford."
sentences.cn: 威尔逊淡淡一笑，“我们已经决定以市政议员明福德的名字给这个新疗养院命名。”

words.tran_cn: 薄的；瘦的；稀薄的；微弱的

trans.tran_cn: 薄薄地，稀疏地，细细地，勉强地
trans.tran_en: scattered or spread over a large area, with a lot of space in between
